result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon D Sandifer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 87 days served. This is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court granted expunction if all mandatory costs are paid.
Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges are due by 06/19/2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon D Sandifer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: CORRECTION; Sentencing entry on 6/19/2015 to reflect due date of costs. Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges are due by 06/19/2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

AS TO COUNT 2
Court ordered defendant to serve 87 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 87 days served. This is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges; to include the DNA and victim/witness surcharge. 

Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court granted expunction if all mandatory costs are paid. 

Filed, 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Devon D Sandifer in court with attorney Joshua Davis Uller.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached an agreement. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 1 Dismissed, But Read In.

AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, Addendum, and Jury Instructions/Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

15RM028063  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:

Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $100.00 cash. All other conditions remain in effect.

Defendant Devon D Sandifer in court with attorney Joshua D. Uller.  Defendant Devon D Sandifer in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION including drug testing.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SHAWN H., OSSIE B., JAMAL C., AND GEOGRAPHIC AREA:  W. NORTH AVE., TO W. LLOYD ST., AND N. 16TH ST. TO N. 17TH ST.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
